reviews.review_msg: Great prof. She was my 4th year Stats prof and I really, really enjoyed the material. And I hate  or stats or any kind of Excel use. Somehow she made it interesting and enjoyable. The assignments were engaging and I found her very helpful in this pretty difficult course.
Exams are brutal. She expected too much from the 1st year students.

Lorinda was a great prof & really easy going & her lectures were actually interesting. My class was at the Harbour Centre so the class was small & she really encouraged class discussion, which was great. Exams were easy & final was not cumulative. Just go to class and study her notes and you will do fine.

The midterm was hard but the final was ridicously hard(all the side comments that didn't matter.. did not use anything from the text)! plus she made the final 3 weeks early( but you still have to go to class) and now we have a team presentation and paper due on the  last day of class. Avoid her if you can.. i will in the future!

If you can find a class with Melissa Robert (Stoneman's T.A.) as the T.A. or a lecturer ... take it! Simon Fraser is lucky to have her. She is well-prepared,interesting,insightful, she cares about the students and their level and she knows her "stuff".

Teaching is an "art" that Ms. Stoneman has not mastered! She teaches from the text, her slides are difficult to read and riddled with mistakes and her exams are way beyond the ability of ist year students.Her lectures are designed to impress us with her abilities and are ill-conceived for beginners.She should record her lectures.

Exams are BRUTAL. Do NOT take this class with Lorinda, if possible. Nice person, very polite and happy, but structures her exams in a ridiculous fashion (fill in the blanks, mc, tf, written, essays..), making them very complicated and exhaustion. Avoid the "Crim104 + Lorinda" combination at all costs.
She is a nice person but not a good prof. Too many additional readings for 1st year student. Her exams are really, really, really hard..dont take this course w/ her.

This prof is getting better with more experience. She works hard to bring in extra material that is interesting and makes students think. Sometimes she goes overboard with it. Lectures are fairly well organized. Her marking is fair, just study hard. She relies heavily on the text.

i took the course in spring term and it was the worst crim class ever...she is quite nice person but not a good prof.. there were so many additional reading stuffs beside the textbook and exams were SO hard.. too difficult for 1st yr students for sure.. take dis course w/ other prof.

Lorinda is a nice prof... but as a prof, not so great! She created too much work for a 1st year class and made assigments more complicated than they should be. Her midterm was pretty easy, but her final was HORRIBLE! Usually profs weigh the final mostly on the second half of the semester, but not in this case!
horrible, horrible, horrible. Her lecture notes are in shambles, and exams are extremely hard and complicated.

Of my three years at SFU, this is the most inexperienced prof I have ever encountered. She gives a three hour midterm for a 2 hour period. She makes constant mistakes in her lectures, and her slides are incomprehensible at times. I think my TA was actually more intelligent than her. She is a nice person, but I don't think she's ready to be a prof.

she was the worst prof. i have ever had. She is great person, but she is horrible prof. You have to complete 4 or 5(?) essays and  complicated multiple choices and true or false in just 2 hrs. It was horrible class.

needs to learn how to be more organized in lectures, and how to structure her exams appropriately to the year level she is teaching, AND most importantly, needs to have reasonable expectations of her students.

The teacher prepared well her lectures. She is very hard on her herself and that does reflect on her expectations towards the students. She needs to ease off on herself and also when correcting the papers otherwise we will see a lot of failure in the class once again due to severe correction. An intro course differ widely from a master degree one.
she needs to post her notes...

She's the prof for this course, not the TA. She's very kind and helpful to students, but her inexperience shows. Lecture is kind of disorganized and it's not always clear what is important to know. I think with more experience and a bit better understanding of the material she'll be a great prof one day.
Great TA! Very knowledgeable and helpful. Wish we had more TAs like her
